questions.text: A 28-year-old has progressive dementia, jaundice and akinetic rigidity in his upper limbs. Which of the following is incorrect?

options.label: C
options.text: High serum ceruloplasmin, Low urinary copper

questions.correct_answer: C. High serum ceruloplasmin, Low urinary copper

questions.text: All are the indications for insertion of endotracheal tube in neonate except:

options.label: A
options.text: Heart rate remains less than 100 and is not increasing after PPV with a face mask

questions.text: A 33-year-old male met with a road traffic accident. There is persistent watery discharge mixed with blood from his nose for 3 days which cannot be sniffed back. Which of the following should not be done in this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Plan surgical treatment with functional endoscopic sinus surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Bed rest and avoiding strenuous activity

questions.correct_answer: B. Plan surgical treatment with functional endoscopic sinus surgery

questions.text: 25 yr old male pt presents with h/o chronic diarrhoea, bloating and significant weight loss with decrease in appetite. Small bowel biopsy given below. Most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old presents with joint pain and hematuria after a bout of pharyngitis. Examination shows petechiae in skin, RBC casts in urine and an elevated igA in the blood. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
Following field defects are seen in:
Newborn child, 2 days of age is suspected to have jitteriness. All of the following are true regarding jitteriness except:
questions.correct_answer: D. Change in heart rate present

questions.text: A 5-year-old child was brought to OPD with a history of URTI. He also has features of mouth breathing, sleep apnoea and nasal obstruction. The mother has noticed that the child increases the volume while watching TV. What is the appropriate management?
The following bodies are seen post splenectomy-
All of the statements are true for the condition in the image except

options.label: A
options.text: Usually present on the nasal side

options.label: B
options.text: Vision becomes impaired due to induced astigmatism

options.label: C
options.text: Induces corneal steepening against the axis of it.

options.label: D
options.text: Encroaches upon the cornea destroying the superficial layers of the stroma and Descemet’s layer

questions.correct_answer: D. Encroaches upon the cornea destroying the superficial layers of the stroma and Descemet’s layer

questions.text: 6 days old child reports with lethargy following two episodes of frank large blood stained vomitus. He was born at home and was an exclusive breast feed since birth. There are no specific findings on systemic examination. Which of the following findings can see in the child?
Father has XLD disorder. How many % of daughters will be affected by the disease further ?

As compared to cow’s milk breast milk contains all of the following more except:
Which of the following is true about Little's area

options.label: A
options.text: Keisselbach's plexus is suuplied mainly by sphenopalatine artery.

options.label: B
options.text: It is present on lateral wall of nose

options.label: C
options.text: It is present in the posterior part of nasal cavity

options.label: D
options.text: It is rare site of epistaxis

questions.correct_answer: A. Keisselbach's plexus is suuplied mainly by sphenopalatine artery.

questions.text: 42 yr old pt with long standind h/o multinodular goitre presents with mass in thyroid gland measuring 3*2*1cm on USG. FNAC reveals microfollicular pattern with few hurthle cells. Biopsy shows an encapsulated tumor with tumor cells arranged in follicles. Capsular invasion is seen . Genetic analysis shows RAS mutation . Diagnosis?
Choice of treatment for neovascular glaucoma is:

5 years old has episodes where she stops her activity for a few seconds, stares blankly ahead and then resumes the activity as if she had never stopped. These episodes happen many times in a day. Most appropriate management in this child will be:

options.label: D
options.text: MRI – Brain to rule out degenerative disorders

questions.text: 11 yr old pt presents with h/o recurrent infections, easy bruising and light sensitivity. He is noted to have fair skin , silver grey hair& nystagmus. Lab inv shows prolonged bleeding time . Genetic testing confirms mutation in LYST gene. Which of the following cellular processes is most likely defective in this pt ?
A pregnant woman has open angles and IOP 28, 30 mm Hg (OD, OS) and CDR 0.8, 0.8. Which of the following should be done?

A cyanotic new born is suspected of having CHD. He has a pan systolic murmur audible at left sternal border. Chest X-ray shows decreased pulmonary blood flow, oligemic lung fields. ECG shows left axis deviation. Most likely diagnosis is:
Which of the following is true of vocal fold polyps?

options.label: B
options.text: They arise from the vocal cord ligament

options.label: C
options.text: They are best assessed on stroboscopy

options.label: D
options.text: They always require surgery for resolution

questions.correct_answer: C. They are best assessed on stroboscopy

questions.text: 57 yr old pt presents with progressive shortness of breath , fatigue . Examination revealed enlarged and hypokinetic heart.. ECHO confirms dilatation of cardiac chambers and reduced systolic function . Myocardial biopsy is shown below . Which of the following is the most likely cause of the shown histological finding?

options.label: D
options.text: Useful to examine periphery of retina

questions.text: A 10 years old girl is brought to OPD by her parents who are worried the she is shortest girl in her class. Her height is 100.5 cm and her weight 26 Kg. The rest of her physical examination shows nothing abnormal. Her father is 175 cm tall and her mother, who attained menarche at the age of 16 years, is 165 cm tall. The patient’s wrist X-ray show a bone age of 8 years, diagnosis is:
Which of the following vitamin deficiencies can cause laryngismus stridulus?

Which cataract surgery step is being done?

A 5 yr old boy presents with pubic hair development. He is tall and has increased pigmentation of his genitalia and phallic enlargement. Blood pressure is 130/90 mm Hg. Measurement of which of the following hormones would be most likely to be diagnostic:

10 months old child is lethargic, not accepting feeds and passed urine 6 hour back. There is history of loose stools since 2 days. The child needs to be started on intravenous fluid. In this child according to IMNCI which plan of management is required:
A female patient with hearing loss is examined and is found to be Rinne negative at 256 Hz and 512 Hz, while Rinne positive at 1024 Hz What is the expected air conduction and bone conduction gap?

A female software engineer presents to OPD with C/O easy fatigue. She gives a history of sitting in front of computer for 12-14 hrs per day. She takes more junk food and no fruits and veggies. CBC findings are Hb- 9 gm%, MCV- 120. What is the most likely cause of anemia due to deficiency of –
Right trochlear nerve palsy, all are present except

options.label: B
options.text: Diplopia on upper gaze and adduction

questions.text: Congenital intrauterine infection may affect the brain. Brain involvement is most commonly seen in:
questions.correct_answer: A. Rubella and Herpes Simplex virus

questions.text: A patient of suspected sinusitis has undergone CT scan of sinuses. The radiologist reports an anatomical variation of posterior ethmoid air cell lying in close proximity to optic nerve. Identify the cell?

Dystrophic calcification means –

options.label: B
options.text: Calcification in normal tissue seen in hyperparathyroidism

options.label: C
options.text: Calcification in destroyed tissue with hypercalcemia

options.label: D
options.text: Calcification in destroyed tissue with normal calcium level in blood

questions.correct_answer: D. Calcification in destroyed tissue with normal calcium level in blood

questions.text: Transparency of cornea is mainly due to which layer
Most common chronic glomerulopathy seen in children is IgA nephropathy. True regarding IgA nephropathy is:
questions.correct_answer: C. Normal serum levels of C3

questions.text: Given investigation of larynx is based on:

options.label: A
options.text: Rigid endoscopy of larynx with continuous light

options.label: B
options.text: Flexible endoscopy of larynx with blue light

options.label: C
options.text: Rigid endoscopy of larynx with flashing light

options.label: D
options.text: Flexible endoscopy of larynx with continuous light

questions.correct_answer: C. Rigid endoscopy of larynx with flashing light

questions.text: Liver biopsy from a patient is as follows. What is likely diagnosis?

A 7-year-old child with a 3-yr history of cough, intermittent wheezing, and poor growth has 2 sweat chloride values of 36 and 41 mEq/L. Additional diagnostic testing to rule out cystic fibrosis should include:
Which of the following statement is incorrect

options.label: A
options.text: Osteomas are most commonly seen in frontal sinus

options.label: B
options.text: Malignancy is most common in Maxillary sinus

options.label: C
options.text: Fungal balls are most common in Ethmoid sinus

options.label: D
options.text: Mucoceles are most common in Frontal sinus

questions.correct_answer: C. Fungal balls are most common in Ethmoid sinus

questions.text: A 53-year old smoker presents with weight loss and hematemesis. An endoscopy performed showed an ulcer in the antrum with loss of mucosal rugae, no obvious mass was seen. A biopsy was done and is as shown under. The most likely diagnosis is
Which of the following not given as eye drops in corneal ulcer?
Which of the following waves on given investigation is the most sensitive to hearing loss?
The finding given in the following image is seen in –
Most common muscle involved in Grave’s ophthalmopathy is
Which of the following is a wrong match

options.label: A
options.text: Mulberry appearance of nasal mucosa- --Inferior turbinate hypertrophy

options.label: B
options.text: Strawberry appearance of nasal mucosa—tuberculosis of nose

questions.correct_answer: B. Strawberry appearance of nasal mucosa—tuberculosis of nose

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about physiology of nose

options.label: A
options.text: The inspiratory and expiratory air currents pass through middle part of nasal cavity

options.label: B
options.text: Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration

options.label: C
options.text: Nasal cilia beat 10-20 times per second and mucociliary clearance time is 10 -20 minutes.

options.label: D
options.text: Nasal cycle of rhythmic congestion and decongestion varies every 2.5 to 4 hours

questions.correct_answer: B. Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration
